metadata.Title: CVE-2019-19553 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
In Wireshark 3.0.0 to 3.0.6 and 2.6.0 to 2.6.12, the CMS dissector couldcrash. This was addressed in epan/dissectors/asn1/cms/packet-cms-template.cby ensuring that an object identifier is set to NULL after a ContentInfodissection.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19553` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 3.0.7-1
libwireshark13 - 3.0.7-1
libwiretap10 - 3.0.7-1
libwsutil11 - 3.0.7-1
tshark - 3.0.7-1
wireshark - 3.0.7-1
wireshark-common - 3.0.7-1
wireshark-gtk - 3.0.7-1
wireshark-qt - 3.0.7-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: wireshark package in esm-apps/focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.0.7-1').
